New York University Archives
Waldo Chapin Collection
Chapin, Waldo
MC.277
1.25 Linear Feet in 1 half manuscript box and 1 oversize flat box
1947-1948 Waldo E. Chapin (1917 - 2011) graduated from New York University with a Degree of Bachelor of Science in February 1948. The collection contains Chapin’s final examination portfolio for his Introduction to Art course, a graduation confirmation letter, and a 1948 commencement program. Materials are in English.
Arrangement
The collection is arranged topically.
Biographical / Historical
Waldo Chapin (1917 - 2011) graduated from New York University with a Degree of Bachelor of Science in February 1948. Chapin was a Staff Sergeant in the U.S. Army Air Corps where he served from 1939-1945. He worked at the National Council on Compensation Insurance (NCCI) for forty years.
Conditions Governing Access
Materials are open to researchers.
Immediate Source of Acquisition
There is no documentation concerning the provenance of these materials.
Conditions Governing Use
Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the: New York University Archives

New York, NY 10012

Preferred Citation
Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Waldo Chapin Collection; MC 277; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.
Processing Information
At the point of accessioning materials were placed in acid free folders and boxes, and described at the collection-level with an item-level inventory. No other physical intervention or processing was performed at this stage.
Scope and Contents
Waldo Chapin (1917-2011) graduated from New York University with a Degree of Bachelor of Science in February 1948. This collection consists of Chapin’s final examination portfolio for his Introduction to Art course, a graduation confirmation letter, and a 1948 commencement program.
Commencement ceremonies New York University -- Alumni Examinations (documents) Art.
